attributes.text:
This is a basic form field with common functionality for {@link TextArea} and {@link TextField}.

On every keystroke the value is synchronized with the value of the textfield. Value changes can be monitored by listening to the {@link #input} or {@link #changeValue} events, respectively.
initial text value of the input field ({@link #setValue}).

The event is fired each time the text field looses focus and the text field values has changed.

If you change {@link #liveUpdate} to true, the changeValue event will be fired after every keystroke and not only after every focus loss. In that mode, the changeValue event is equal to the {@link #input} event.

The method {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} returns the current text value of the field.

The event is fired on every keystroke modifying the value of the field.

The method {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} returns the current value of the text field.
Returns the placeholder label and creates it if necessary.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property enabled.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyEnabled}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property font.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyFont}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyPlaceholder}.

Creates the input element. Derived classes may override this method, to create different input elements.
a new input element.
Returns the text size.
The text size.
Incoming change event
Event listener for change event of content element
Input event
Event listener for native input events. Redirects the event to the widget. Also checks for the filter and max length.
Helper to remove the placeholder. Deletes the placeholder text from the field and removes the state.
Helper to show the placeholder text in the field. It checks for all states and possible conditions and shows the placeholder only if allowed.
Updates the placeholder text with the DOM
Clears the current selection. This method only works if the widget is already created and added to the document.

Returns the (computed) value of the property filter.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #filter}.
(Computed) value of filter.

Returns the (computed) value of the property liveUpdate.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #liveUpdate}.
(Computed) value of liveUpdate.

Returns the (computed) value of the property maxLength.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #maxLength}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property placeholder.

Returns the (computed) value of the property textAlign.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #textAlign}.
(Computed) value of textAlign.
Returns the current selection. This method only works if the widget is already created and added to the document.
Returns the end of the text selection
End of selection or null if not available
Returns the current selection length. This method only works if the widget is already created and added to the document.
Returns the start of the text selection
Start of selection or null if not available
Returns the current value of the textfield.
The current value
Initial value for property filter.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property filter with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #filter}.
the default value
Initial value for property liveUpdate.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property liveUpdate with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #liveUpdate}.
the default value
Initial value for property maxLength.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property maxLength with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #maxLength}.
the default value

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property placeholder with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #placeholder}.
the default value

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property readOnly with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property textAlign with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #textAlign}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property liveUpdate equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #readOnly}.
Whether the property equals true.

Resets the user value of the property filter.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #filter}.

start of the selection (zero-based)
end of the selection

Set the selection to the given start and end (zero-based). If no end value is given the selection will extend to the end of the textfield’s content. This method only works if the widget is already created and added to the document.
The new value
Sets the value of the textfield to the given value.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property liveUpdate.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #liveUpdate}.
the new value

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property readOnly.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #readOnly}.
the new value

RegExp responsible for filtering the value of the textfield. the RegExp gives the range of valid values. The following example only allows digits in the textfield.

field.setFilter(/[0-9]/);
Whether the {@link #changeValue} event should be fired on every key input. If set to true, the changeValue event is equal to the {@link #input} event.
Maximal number of characters that can be entered in the TextArea.
String value which will be shown as a hint if the field is all of: unset, unfocused and enabled. Set to null to not show a placeholder text.
Whether the field is read only
Alignment of the text
